isis.stitle: TSI 94-16-01 - Modification Of The Short Filler To Roof Fairing Extender and Sleeper Box Extender Installation

subjectgroup.subject: Modification Of The Short Filler To Roof Fairing Extender and Sleeper Box Extender Installation

geninfo.para: To prevent damage from occurring to the roof fairing extender, the short filler panel and/or the sleeper box extender on 9200, 9300 and 9400 model vehicles built after January 4, 1993, the following modification should be made to the short filler to roof airing extender and sleeper box extender installation.

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE
svcproc.para: The following procedure is for one side of the vehicle, repeat on the opposite side of the vehicle.
Refer to Figure 1 for all items in parentheses unless otherwise stated.

step1.para: Remove the two 5/16 inch nuts, flat washers and bolts (Item 6) that secure the short filler (Item 5) to the sleeper box extender (Item 7).
Remove the 5/16 inch nut, flat washer and bolt that secure the roof fairing extender brace (Item 2) to the roof fairing side extender (Item 1).

Remove the 5/16 inch nut and flat washer that secure the roof fairing extender brace (Item 2) to the air deflector mounting bracket (Item 3). Remove the second 5/16 inch nut and flat washer from the air deflector mounting bracket (Item 3).

Manufacture a 1/4 inch thick spacer to fit between the air deflector mounting bracket (Item 3) and the air deflector mounting support (Item 4). Make the spacer large enough to include the full width and length of the air deflector mounting bracket base.
Cut two slots in the spacer to allow it to fit around the two studs that protrude upward from the air deflector mounting support (Item 4) through the air deflector mounting bracket (Item 3).

Raise the air deflector mounting bracket (Item 3) high enough to insert the spacer between it and the air deflector mounting support (Figure 1). Install 5/16 inch lock nuts on the two studs protruding through the air deflector mounting bracket. Tighten both nuts.

The studs protruding through the air deflector mounting bracket are not long enough to remount the roof fairing extender brace to. Position the roof fairing extender brace (Item 2) on the air deflector mounting bracket (Item 3) and the roof fairing side extender (Item 2) as illustrated in Figure 1.

Mount the end of the roof fairing extender brace (Item 2) on the roof deflector side extender as illustrated in Figure 1 in the hole it was removed from with the 5/16 inch bolt, flat washer and nut removed in step 2. It may be necessary to elongate the hole in the brace and grind off the corner to make it fit. Hand tighten the nut.

caution.para: Place a piece of wood or metal between the air deflector mounting support and the cab when drilling the following hole to prevent drilling through the top of the cab.

step1.para: Use the roof fairing extender brace hole as a template and drill a hole (the size of the hole in the brace) through the air deflector mounting bracket, the 1/4 inch spacer and the air deflector mounting support at this location. Secure the brace in this location with 5/16 inch X 1-1/2 inch bolt, flat washer and nut. Tighten the nut.
Make sure all fasteners are tight.
Cut a piece of 1 inch X 1 inch X .100 inch aluminum angle stock 10 inches long. Measure 5 inches from one end of the angle stock and place a pencil mark at this location.
Drill two equally spaced 3/16 inch holes on each side of the center mark on the angle stock (four holes total).

Position the angle stock so that the center mark on the angle stock is at the gap between the roof fairing side extender (Item 1, Figure 2) and the small filler (Item 3, Figure 2). Hold the angle stock in position with a clamp.

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. 1 INCH X 1 INCH X 10 INCH X .100 INCH ALUMINUM STOCK

step1.para: Drill a 3/16 inch hole into the extender and filler in each hole location on the 1 inch angle stock. Care should be taken not to drill completely through the extender and filler.
Secure the 1 inch angle stock to the extender and fill with 3/16 inch pop rivets (Figure 2).

svcproc.para: Repeat this procedure on the opposite side of vehicle.
